title: Large scrub fire burns in the lower Waimakariri Gorge
text:
Large scrub fire burns in the lower Waimakariri Gorge MONIQUE STEELE Last updated 11:09, February 4 2017 Supplied 
The fire from across the valley in a photograph sent by a reader. 
Firefighters are trying to contain a large scrub fire in rural Canterbury. 
A water-dumping helicopter is headed for the isolated area near Springfield to contain the blaze which was first reported in the early hours of Saturday morning. 
The fire is located on public conservation land near the rail bridge over Broken River just south west of where it meets the Waimakariri River. It is far from any houses. Putting out the blaze is made more difficult with Saturday's hot, windy weather conditions, a Fire Service spokesman said. SUPPLIED/Bronwyn McClintock 
Smoke seen from above at the south end of Lees Valley. 
"It's a relatively big fire and by the way the wind's blowing, people will see it coming down the Canterbury Plains," a fire spokesman said. 
"It's a really isolated area, there's no roads into there. 
Can you see this fire? Send photos to reporters@press.co.nz Stephen Russell 
The Broken River Viaduct on the Christchurch to Greymouth railway line in 2012. 
The fire spokesman said the cause of the fire was still unknown, but there was a railway nearby. 
"We have had a history of fires there in the past. 
"Some were caused by the trains and some caused by people, its too early to tell here."
